meaningMnemonic: You ate some <radical>grain</radical>s that made you so <radical>sick</radical> it feels like a <radical>knife</radical> is stabbing in your guts and all your poop is falling out. This is called <kanji>diarrhea</kanji>. Everyone's had diarrhea before, so you should know this feeling by now.
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>diarrhea</kanji> is here. It's happening. And it smells so awful you can't breathe. You have to take some hollow <reading>reed</reading>s (り) and shove them up your nose and out the bathroom door so you can get some fresh air in you.
